entry.title: Physicists Set Quantum Record By Using Photons To Carry Messages From Electrons Almost 2 Kilometers Apart

link.title: Physicists Set Quantum Record By Using Photons To Carry Messages From Electrons Almost 2 Kilometers Apart

entry.content:
Researchers from Stanford have advanced a long-standing problem in quantum physics – how to send “entangled” particles over long distances.

Tags - quantum physics

entry.title: New Gene Map Reveals Cancer S Achilles Heel

link.title: New Gene Map Reveals Cancer S Achilles Heel

entry.content:
(University of Toronto) Scientists have mapped out the genes that keep our cells alive, creating a long-awaited foothold for understanding how our genome works and which genes are crucial in disease like cancer.

Tags -

Visit Link
entry.summary: (University of Toronto) Scientists have mapped out the genes that keep our cells alive, creating a long-awaited foothold for understanding how our genome works and which genes are crucial in disease like cancer.

entry.title: Cern Collides Heavy Nuclei At New Record High Energy

link.title: Cern Collides Heavy Nuclei At New Record High Energy

entry.content:
(University of Copenhagen - Niels Bohr Institute) The world’s most powerful accelerator, the 27 km long Large Hadron Collider operating at CERN in Geneva established collisions between lead nuclei, this morning, at the highest energies ever. The experiments aim at understanding and studying the properties of strongly interacting systems at high densities and thus the state of matter of the Universe shortly after the Big Bang.

Tags -

Visit Link
entry.summary: (University of Copenhagen - Niels Bohr Institute) The world’s most powerful accelerator, the 27 km long Large Hadron Collider operating at CERN in Geneva established collisions between lead nuclei, this morning, at the highest energies ever. The experiments aim at understanding and studying the properties of strongly interacting systems at high densities and thus the state of matter of the Universe shortly after the Big Bang.

In addition to quantum-computing applications, the system could be used as an in vivo biological sensor

entry.title: Earth Not Due For A Geomagnetic Flip In The Near Future Researchers Show

link.title: Earth Not Due For A Geomagnetic Flip In The Near Future Researchers Show

entry.content:
The intensity of Earth’s geomagnetic field has been dropping for the past 200 years, at a rate that some scientists suspect may cause the field to bottom out in 2,000 years, temporarily leaving the planet unprotected against damaging charged particles from the sun. This drop in intensity is associated with periodic geomagnetic field reversals, in which the Earth’s North and South magnetic poles flip polarity, and it could last for several thousand years before returning to a stable, shielding intensity.

Tags - earth sciences

Visit Link

entry.title: 100 Renewable Electricity Is It Possible Right Now

link.title: 100 Renewable Electricity Is It Possible Right Now

entry.content:
By Roberto Verzola Most national 100%-renewable electricity scenarios target the 2030-2050 period, which is still a long way off. More easily attainable today is a highly focused intermediate goal: 100%-renewables for new demand, that is, for future demand over and above what is already covered today by existing or committed power plan.
